instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-04 ME region needed
threads.message:
i changed PCH <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> due to <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> shorted. 
now the device is able to turn on but it restarts 
i just need Me region to be cleared.

Thanks in advance

orig bin file: [URL]https://ufile.io/nneqdl4j[/URL]

Probably GPU issue.
Start in Target Disk mode and save data.

Please, don't quote an entire post visible few centimeters above...
